step_by_step.explanation: Price elasticity of demand measures how responsive quantity demanded is to a change in price.
Elasticity = (% change in quantity demanded) / (% change in price).

problems.final_answer: Price elasticity of demand measures responsiveness of Qd to price changes.

problems.problem: Explain the difference between elastic and inelastic demand.

step_by_step.explanation: Elastic demand occurs when elasticity > 1; quantity demanded responds strongly to price changes.
Inelastic demand occurs when elasticity < 1; quantity demanded responds weakly to price changes.

problems.problem: List three determinants of price elasticity of demand.

step_by_step.explanation: Availability of substitutes, proportion of income spent on the good, and necessity versus luxury status.

problems.final_answer: Substitutes, income share, necessity vs. luxury.

problems.problem: Define cross-price elasticity of demand and interpret its signs.

step_by_step.explanation: Cross-price elasticity measures how the quantity demanded of one good responds to the price change of another good.

problems.problem: Define income elasticity of demand and interpret its signs.

step_by_step.explanation: Income elasticity measures how quantity demanded changes in response to changes in consumer income.
Positive → normal good; Negative → inferior good.

problems.final_answer: Positive = normal good; Negative = inferior good.

problems.problem: Explain the relationship between total revenue and elasticity of demand.

step_by_step.explanation: Price increase → TR decreases; Price decrease → TR increases.
Price increase → TR increases; Price decrease → TR decreases.

problems.final_answer: Elastic: TR moves opposite price; Inelastic: TR moves with price; Unit: TR constant.

step_by_step.explanation: Total satisfaction gained from consuming a good or service.
Additional satisfaction from consuming one more unit of a good.

problems.final_answer: Utility = total satisfaction; marginal utility = additional satisfaction.

problems.problem: State the law of diminishing marginal utility.

step_by_step.explanation: As more units of a good are consumed, marginal utility from each additional unit decreases.

problems.final_answer: Marginal utility decreases with additional consumption.

problems.problem: Explain the utility-maximizing rule using marginal utility per dollar.

step_by_step.explanation: Consumers maximize utility when MUx/Px = MUy/Py for all goods.
This ensures the last dollar spent on each good yields equal marginal utility, preventing any reallocation from increasing total utility.

problems.final_answer: Utility maximized when MU per dollar is equal across all goods.

problems.problem: Explain how indifference curves represent consumer preferences.

step_by_step.explanation: An indifference curve shows all combinations of two goods that give a consumer the same level of satisfaction.
Slope represents marginal rate of substitution (how much of one good the consumer is willing to give up for the other).

problems.final_answer: Indifference curves show equal-utility bundles and slope = marginal rate of substitution.
